access.notes: No access restrictions on this person's data.

description: An object providing information about a Person
$comment: This is a top-level database object
title: Person

___link.description: A URL where a presentational format for this resource may be viewed
___link.title: Link

___birthDate.description: This person’s birth date, in [internet date time format](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime)
___birthDate.title: Birth Date

$eref.description: A reference to an item in a database, used when you wish to store an item separately in the database (following a relational database model), rather than inline. A disadvantage of this approach is that it often requires making multiple database calls. To avoid this, in most cases the actual object can be used instead of a database reference. For example, instead of making a reference to a separate Person file, you can simply include the Person object directly in place of the database reference. This is useful when you don't want to deal with cross references and multiple database calls. In this case, it is often a good idea to include just a minimal set of data. For a person, for example, you might include just the ID, abbreviation, family name, and given name. This prevents you from having to replicate all of the data about that Person each time it is used.
$eref.title: Database Reference

___name.description: The name of the referenced database item, optionally in multiple languages.
___name.title: Name

___abbreviation.description: The abbreviation of the referenced database item.
___abbreviation.title: Referenced Abbreviation

___key.description: The key of the referenced database item
___key.title: Referenced Key

___index.description: The index of the referenced database item. Indexes should start at 1 rather than 0 to increase human readability.
___index.title: Referenced Index

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `DatabaseReference`.
___type.title: Type

___url.description: The URL of the referenced database item
___url.title: Referenced URL

___id.description: The ID of the referenced database item
___id.title: Referenced ID

___filename.description: If the reference database item is a media item, use this field for the name of the referenced file.
___filename.title: Filename

___referenceType.description: The type of database item being referenced
___referenceType.title: Referenced Item Type

___birthPlace.description: A database reference to this person’s place of birth, as a Location object
___birthPlace.title: Birth Place (Database Reference)

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `Person`.
___type.title: Type

$eref.description: A tag is a piece of metadata that can be applied to almost any DLx object. The tags object contains a set of tags for this resource as pairs of attributes and values. For example, a researcher might tag a suffix with the attribute `person`, and a value of `3`, to indicate that the particular suffix is 3rd Person. If no value is needed, the value may also be set to `true` or `false` (but not `null`), however users are encouraged to use both attribute and value for every tag, since this helps identify the larger category that the tag value belongs to. Note: The Tags object does not have a `type` property.

additionalProperties.description: A single tag, as an attribute-value pair.
additionalProperties.title: Tag

$eref.title: Tags

___tags.description: A set of tags for this Person
___tags.title: Tags

___startDate.description: The date a person began work on a project, a language documentation, the transcription of a text, or another form of data collection or research. This field is most useful when the Person object is being used as part of the Language.contributor and Text.contributor fields.
___startDate.title: Start Date

___roles.description: An array of the roles that this person has in the context of the associated data, e.g. `speaker` or `transcriber`
___roles.title: Roles

items.description: The role that this person has in the context of the associated data, e.g. `speaker` or `transcriber`
items.title: Role

___endDate.description: The date a person finished work on a project, a language documentation, the transcription of a text, or another form of data collection or research. This field is most useful when the Person object is being used as part of the Language.contributor and Text.contributor fields.
___endDate.title: End Date

notes.eng: Speaker also requested that this text only be shared with family members.
The tribe has requested that language materials only be made available to academic researchers who have been given permission, and enrolled tribal members.

$eref.description: The Access Rights object provides information for archives on who should be allowed to access the current resource. Some access protocols used by language archives are already supported, and custom protocols may be used as, e.g. `online: false` or `permission: researcher only`, etc. **Note:** The Access object does not have a `type` property.
$eref.title: Access Rights

___ELAR.description: For users who are depositing their materials at the Endangered Language Archive (ELAR) in London, an `ELAR` attribute may be added, and its value set to one of the access levels set forth by the archive. See [ELAR's protocols for access management](https://www.soas.ac.uk/elar/using-elar/access-protocol/) for more information.
___ELAR.title: ELAR Access Level

___AILLA.description: For users who are depositing their materials at The Archive of the Indigenous Languages of Latin America (AAILA) in Texas, an `AILLA` attribute may be added, and its value set to one of the access levels set forth by the archive.
___AILLA.title: AILLA Access Level

___notes.description: Notes about access rights for this resource, or any other special considerations regarding who should have Access. This attribute should be a MultiLangString rather than an Array of Note objects.
___notes.title: Access Notes

___access.description: The access rights for information about this person
___access.title: Access Rights

$eref.description: A human-readable abbreviation, containing on letters `a-z`, `A-Z`, and numbers `0-9` (no spaces allowed).
$eref.title: Abbreviation

___abbreviation.description: An abbreviation for this person (typically their initials). If a pseudonym is used for this person, use the initials of the pseudonym rather than their actual initials.
___abbreviation.title: Abbreviation

___givenName.description: This person’s given name(s) (first name(s)), including middle name(s), if any
___givenName.title: Given Name(s) / First Name(s)

___url.description: The URL where the JSON data for this Person may be accessed
___url.title: URL

___languages.description: A list of the languages that this person speaks. Each item should be a DLx Language object, optionally with a few additional properties such as `ageLearned`, etc., Because the DLx Language object consist minimally of just the language name, not all details about the language need to be provided here.
___languages.title: Languages Spoken

notes.text: The best documentary materials on this language are those compiled by Morris Swadesh in 1930–1934.

notes.eng: Materials on this language should not be made available to non-tribal members without permission.

notes.text: This is the official orthography used by the Chitimacha Tribe.

note.text: This is the name commonly used for the language by French colonials.

notes.text: In older versions of your notes, you referred to this language as Kisii rather than Gusii.

notes.eng: Unless otherwise noted, materials for this language may be made publicly accessible, and the speakers in the content identified.

notes.text: This orthography represents the way that the language is written when using the Swahili orthography. Tone is omitted from this orthography.

note.text: This is a Swahili version of the name of this language. It is an alternate for simply `Kisii`.

$eref.description: DLx uses the term *language* broadly to refer to any speech variety - whether a language, dialect, idiolect, or even a historical variety. The DLx `Language` object groups together all the information about the language, including writing systems, its phonological inventory, and metadata (e.g. names and language codes).
$eref.$comment: This is a top-level database object
$eref.title: Language

___link.description: A URL where a presentational format for this resource may be viewed
___link.title: Link

___dateModified.description: The date an optionally time that this Language object was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date Modified

___autonym.description: The autonym for this language, optionally in multiple orthographies. Note that this is a transcription of the autonym, and so should not be capitalized.
___autonym.title: Autonym

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `Language`.
___type.title: Type

___classification.description: The genetic classification of this language. This property must be an array of language families (in English), with larger family groupings listed before smaller ones. For example, Spanish might have an array of the following strings: `Indo-European`, `Romance`, `Ibero-Romance`. For language isolates, this property should be an array containing the single string, `isolate`.
___classification.title: Genetic Classification

items.description: The name of a language family, as a string, in English.
items.title: Language Family

___tags.description: A set of tags for this Language
___tags.title: Tags

___iso.description: The ISO 639-3 code for this language variety, as a 3-letter String
___iso.title: ISO 639-3 Code

___orthographies.description: A collection of orthographies used to represent this Language
___orthographies.title: Orthographies

items.description: An orthography used to represent this language
items.title: Orthography

___contributors.description: A collection of people who contributed to the documentation, analysis, or curation of this language data in some way. It is strongly recommended that each Person object in this collection have its `roles` property specified, so that the contribution of each person is known.
___contributors.title: Contributors

items.description: A database reference to a Person object describing a contributor
items.title: Contributor (Person - Database Reference)

___additionalNames.description: An Array of additional names for this Language. Only use this property if the `name` property is not sufficent to describe the various names for this language. Each additional name can be a plain string, or an object with two properties: `name` and `note`. The object format is preferred, since the `note` field provides a way to give a description of this additional name and where or by whom it was used.
___additionalNames.title: Additional Names

___note.description: A note about this additional language, explaining where it is used and who uses it. You should use the `language` property of the Note to describe what language this additional name is in.
___note.title: Additional Language Note

___locations.description: Geographic locations where this language variety is spoken, optionally with geographic coordinate data
___locations.title: Locations

items.description: A database reference to a Location object describing a location where this language variety is spoken
items.title: Location (Database Reference)

___glottolog.description: The Glottolog code for this language variety, as a String in the format abcd1234
___glottolog.title: Glottolog Code

___access.description: An object describing who may have access to materials on this language.
___access.title: Access Rights

___name.description: The name of this Language, optionally in multiple languages. There must be a name provided in at least one language. Use the `additionalNames` field to list names for this language that need additional explanation or notes, or if there are multiple names for this variety in a language.
___name.title: Language Name

___abbreviation.description: A short, human-readable abbreviation for this Language
___abbreviation.title: Abbreviation

___references.description: A collection of bibliographic references about this language. If this collection grows large, it is recommended that references be stored in separate JSON documents instead.
___references.title: Bibliographic References

items.description: A bibliographic reference about this language
items.title: Bibliographic Reference

___url.description: A URL where the JSON data for this language can be found
___url.title: URL

___dateCreated.description: The date and optionally time that this Language object was created
___dateCreated.title: Date Created

___phonemes.description: The phonological inventory for this language, i.e. a collection of phonemes
___phonemes.title: Phonemes

___notes.description: A collection of notes about this language
___notes.title: Notes

___id.description: A unique database identifier for this Language
___id.title: ID

allOf.description: Each item in the `languages` Array must be a valid Language object
allOf.title: Language

___proficiency.description: The proficiency level of this person in this Language
___proficiency.title: Proficiency

___yearsKnown.description: The number of years this person has known this Language
___yearsKnown.title: Years Known

___notes.description: Notes about this person’s use of this language
___notes.title: Notes

examples.text: Msemaji huyu ni Janet Kerubo Momanyi.
Box turtles are known for eating strawberries.

$eref.description: A note about this resource. Notes may also include `type` and `language` attributes.
$eref.title: Note

___language.description: A language code or language name of the language that this note is written in
___language.title: Note Language

___dateModified.description: The date and optionally time that this note was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date Modified

___text.description: The text of the note itself
___text.title: Note Text

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `Note`.
___type.title: Type

___tags.description: A set of tags that apply to this Note. Useful for tagging notes that need review or responses, or marking a note as resolved.
___tags.title: Tags

___dateCreated.description: The date and optionally time that this note was created
___dateCreated.title: Date Created

___noteType.description: The type of Note. Required for notes on Lexemes.
___noteType.title: Note Type

___source.description: The name or initials of the person who is the source of the information in this Note. This is not necessarily the person who wrote it. For example, a linguist could make a note based on something that a speaker reports, in which case the speaker should be listed as the source.
___source.title: Source (Person)

items.description: A note about this person’s use of this language
items.title: Note

___ageLearned.description: The age at which this person learned this language
___ageLearned.title: Age Learned

___phone.description: A phone number for this Person
___phone.title: Phone Number

___streetAddress.description: The street address, not including apartment or unit number
___streetAddress.title: Street Address

___locality.description: The locality or city for this Address
___locality.title: Locality / City

___type.description: The type of object. Must be set to `Address`.
___type.title: Type

___country.description: The country this address is located in
___country.title: Country

___postalCode.description: The postal code for this address (as a string rather than a number)
___postalCode.title: Postal Code

___apartmentNumber.description: The apartment or unit number, along with any abbreviations, e.g. `Apt 20`
___apartmentNumber.title: Apartment / Unit Number

___region.description: The region or state for this Address
___region.title: Region / State

___notes.description: An array of notes about this person
___notes.title: Notes

examples.text: Msemaji huyu ni Janet Kerubo Momanyi.
Box turtles are known for eating strawberries.

$eref.description: A note about this resource. Notes may also include `type` and `language` attributes.
$eref.title: Note

___language.description: A language code or language name of the language that this note is written in
___language.title: Note Language

___text.description: The text of the note itself

___type.title: Type

___tags.description: A set of tags that apply to this Note. Useful for tagging notes that need review or responses, or marking a note as resolved.
___tags.title: Tags

___dateCreated.description: The date and optionally time that this note was created
___dateCreated.title: Date Created

___noteType.description: The type of Note. Required for notes on Lexemes.
___noteType.title: Note Type

___source.description: The name or initials of the person who is the source of the information in this Note. This is not necessarily the person who wrote it. For example, a linguist could make a note based on something that a speaker reports, in which case the speaker should be listed as the source.
___source.title: Source (Person)

___id.description: A unique database identifier for this Person
___id.title: ID
